thread.title: The rover returns! Helen Flanagan back on Coronation Street after Storm Doris disrupted filming
thread.title_full: The rover returns! Helen Flanagan back on Coronation Street after Storm Doris disrupted filming

author: mirror
title: The rover returns! Helen Flanagan back on Coronation Street after Storm Doris disrupted filming
text:
The rover returns! Helen Flanagan back on Coronation Street after Storm Doris disrupted filming The 26 year-old looked more than happy to be back at work Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
She had her work schedule cancelled when Storm Doris literally rained on her parade. 
But Helen Flanagan didn't waist any time in getting back onto the Coronation Street set, as she proved when she was spotted at Manchester's Granada Studios on Sunday. 
The actress and reality TV star, 26, was all smiles as she battled the wet weather to film new scenes on Weatherfield's famous cobbles, where she was protected from the elements by attentive crew-members. (Photo: Mark Campbell/MCPIX) Attentive crew-members keep Helen dry between takes of the ITV soap (Photo: Mark Campbell/MCPIX) Read More Coronation Street filming HALTED as Storm Doris rages on Helen Flanagan and Brooke Vincent in Manchester 
Still, despite the chilly weather, Helen was still keen to flaunt her figure - which she did by shunning a coat and sporting a pair of skinny jeans. 
Cut close to the body to show off her shape, the mother-of-one was clearly keen to flaunt her assets. She matched the look with a hot pink jumper and wore her hair in bunches. 
Just 48 hours earlier, Helen - who plays Rosie Webster - was seen with Brooke Vincent, who plays her on-screen sister Sophie, struggling to rehearse in the wind and rain.
